etymology.description: Pictogram—footprint (pointing down); variant of 夂. Compare 止 (leg up) and 𡕒 (toe left).
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a downward-pointing footprint, evoking a trailing, unhurried step. Its orientation sets it apart from related foot forms, aligning with the sense of slow, following movement.

examples.chinese: 她步履缓慢(她步履緩慢)。
孩子跟在后面，徐徐而行(孩子跟在後面，徐徐而行)。
examples.pinyin: Háizi gēn zài hòumiàn, xúxú ér xíng.
examples.english: The child follows behind, moving slowly.
